pages.text: Cephalaspis was a Devonian Osteostracan, a type of jawless fish, which probably evolved its armor to defend against the predators of its time: Placoderms and Eurypterids. It was a freshwater fish and probably ate smaller invertebrates living among the sand. It was probably a bottom feeder which ate by stirring up the sand by moving its shovel like head from side to side, eating worms or small crustaceans.
